description: This course views the history and legacy of the World Wars through three thematic lenses: the shock
of modernity, the contradictions of empire, and collective memory. From the metropole to the
colonial periphery, individuals in the largest cities and the smallest villages experienced rapid
and seismic upheaval, including extraordinary technological change, political and social
revolution, economic depression, totalitarianism, nuclear war, and the Holocaust.
fullname: The World Wars: Conflict, Culture and the Birth of the Modern World
